vulnerability_findings.name: external-function
external-function
external-function
solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in patch_5.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.18 (patch_5.sol#1): it allows old versions

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in MultiplicatorX3.command (patch_5.sol#17-20):
	-require(bool)(_address.call.value(msg.value)(_data)) patch_5.sol#19

vulnerability_findings.name: low-level-calls
vulnerability_findings.message:
Low level call in MultiplicatorX3.multiplicate (patch_5.sol#22-25):
	-require(bool)(_address.call.value(this.balance + msg.value)()) patch_5.sol#24

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_address' of MultiplicatorX3.command (patch_5.sol#17) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_data' of MultiplicatorX3.command (patch_5.sol#17) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: naming-convention
vulnerability_findings.message: Parameter '_address' of MultiplicatorX3.multiplicate (patch_5.sol#22) is not in mixedCase

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)
vulnerability_findings.message:
A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
Classification: SWC-107

vulnerability_findings.name: External Call To User-Supplied Address (SWC 107)

Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.
